Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that voter turnout in 2016 was not the lowest in 20 years.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is not backed up by accurate data or evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that voter turnout was the lowest in 20 years based on incomplete and inaccurate news reports.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that voter turnout in 2016 was higher than in previous years, contradicting the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by incorrectly stating the voter turnout in the 2016 presidential election.
Understate: The claim understates the actual voter turnout in 2016 by falsely claiming it was the lowest in 20 years.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the low voter turnout in the 2016 presidential election.
